meta.description: The Centurion Lounge at Hong Kong International Airport (HKG), Terminal 1. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: The Centurion Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Just before Gate 60, take the escalators or lift up to the 7th Floor, follow the signs to the lounge entrance.

location.description: Chek Lap Kok, Hong Kong, China

lounge.description:
From the moment you walk in, you'll see that things are different here. Unexpected touches like locally inspired cuisine and a well-appointed shower suite meet productive workspaces with high-speed Wi-Fi.

Learn more at thecenturionlounge.com/locations/hkg/

regulatory: The lounge is under capacity control and will only allow guests to enter 3 hours prior to their flight departure.

reviews.content: I was flying at night time. So people head not much that day. Can take a rest before depart.
Small. Food offerings poor. Stale and cold food. Worn furniture. Sub par. There is a big black card holder area making the poor Platinum card area seem like economy on a low cost airline. Not great.
Extremely small lounge. Overcrowded. Not up to Centurion standards. Try Plaza Premium First instead. Much better.
Far below standard of US Centurion lounges, especially in terms of food and comfortable seating. Service and beverage selection were fine.
Small-ish lounge with limited seating in but airy, bright area. Great food selection and drinks with solid bathrooms and shower. Worth checking out for sure!
Not bad by most lounge standards but not on a par with the other Centurion lounges. Food was good but not great, there were only 4-5 lounge chairs. More space than many of US lounges (except IAH).
A small lounge with limited seating options, particularly any that are comfortable. Food and drink is decent but the lounge smells strongly of fried food in the morning breakfast service.
Great lounge, great service and food selection! However the shower needs some urgent attention, there was mould everywhere which wasn’t a great experience!
Best lounge at HKG. Full stop. Great food, bar and apron views.
Not too big, good seating options, nice bar and food options, friendly staff, nice view into concourse and blazing fast WiFi.
Smaller than average Centurion lounges. No overly comfortable chairs and can be crowded. But food and beverages are quite good and shower access is a plus.
Much smaller than your typical US Centurion Lounge. Separate exclusive area for Centurion cardholders. Decent food options and great drinks and tea. Seating is a bit tight.
Smaller Centurion Lounge, a bit busy.  Somewhere in size between the old Seattle Studio and the current Seattle lounge. Good food spread. Friendly staff. Bartender made a great whisky old fashioned.
About as comfortable as a Pizza Hut. No soft chairs. No carpet. Loud and bright. Not relaxing.
The new Centurion Lounge is a Welcome Home environment when transiting HKG....This did not disappoint.....Rick S. American Flyer 🌎✔️
Space a bit small for int'l location, but was never too crowded. Staff is A++ Good dim sum options. They serve actual champagne. Showers available too. Amazing tarmac views.
Nice quiet and not crowded food selection not bad. Good service. but need  lazy seat to lay back
Best bar, food good. Not much comfort in the seating selection.
Service and staff great.  Food and seating as bad as it gets. The only place that the United lounge is better. Other Centurions great. Skip this one.

A very busy lounge. A good hot buffet, mostly local style dishes. Didn’t try the bar but looked to have a good range of spirits (limited bars). Long queue for the showers unfortunately so couldn’t try.
Excellent food, relatively quiet (on a Sunday afternoon, when the airport is fairly busy). Staff is very nice, tables are kept cleared and furnishings are comfortable.
Good lounge - although small and tables can fill up quickly, usually space to spread out. Good cocktail and liquor selection, and nice & quiet. What more can you ask for?
I’ve been here twice now for dinner and now breakfast. The food and service were nice both times, and it’s the only Centurion lounge I’ve been to so far that has tarmac views.
Decent lounge in HK but falls below typical Centurion size and standards of service, food, and amenities.
Great place to relax and enjoy dinner. Shower wasn’t cleaned up after previous user. No clean toothbrush or towels on hand.
This should really be two lounges, Black and Platinum. The Platinum is good but very small with no real work space. It’s also open to the terminal below so it’s loud.

Too small for Centurion lounges I’m used to. Food below Centurion par but average by other standards. Private area for Black card members. Top shelf liquor and all else you expect from Amex. Just small.

Nice decor. Open and airy. Not too busy. Decent enough food. Unlike Centurion Lounges in the US, emphasis is on higher level card members so Platinum cardmembers are definitely second class for stuff.
Good food, ironically needs more snacks as well. Staff friendly. Great showers and proper bar. Nice design, tho lacks soul & is too open, it needs ‘cosy areas’. Agree that seating isn’t very comfy.
Great service and decent food selection. Unfortunately, at least for me, the seating options were not very comfortable. Perhaps it is different with a black card.
Very comfortable lounge with great service / food / drinks and internet. Perfect location walking distance to most gates. Separate Centurion section is fantastic.
Good hot buffet, excellent cocktails with premium liquor, and nice working areas. No need for CX Lounge unless craving dandan noodles. A tad on the small side, at least for us non-Centurion peeps.
A great lounge while no one knows about it. It is a far better choice than some other first class lounges (read: Thai Airlines lounge is terrible)
Definitely beats all the Plaza Premium Lounges with excellent views and good food. The staff are very attentive and polite. Even beats British Airways business lounge at LHR!
